<ce:table colsep="0" frame="topbot" id="t0015" rowsep="0" xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/cals/dtd">
<ce:label>Table 3</ce:label>
<ce:caption id="cn065">
<ce:simple-para id="sp0075" view="all">Antimicrobial activities of the new Ag(I) complexes and the positive controls<ce:cross-ref id="c0285" refid="tblfn4">
<ce:sup loc="post">a</ce:sup>
</ce:cross-ref>, AgNO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf> and silver sulfadiazine. MIC values are given in μM concentrations of Ag(I) ions.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<tgroup cols="4">
<colspec align="left" colname="col1"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col2"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col3"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col4"></colspec>
<thead>
<row rowsep="1" valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">Complex</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<italic>E. coli</italic> MIC<inf loc="post">50</inf> (μM Ag<sup loc="post">+</sup>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">MRSA MIC<inf loc="post">50</inf> (μM Ag<sup loc="post">+</sup>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<italic>C. albicans</italic> MIC<inf loc="post">100</inf> (μM Ag<sup loc="post">+</sup>)</entry>
</row>
</thead>
<tbody>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag<inf loc="post">4</inf>(DMSO)<inf loc="post">4</inf>(9-aca)<inf loc="post">4</inf>]<italic>
<inf loc="post">n</inf>
</italic> (<bold>1</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">22.12</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">22.38</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">1.92</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(2-Me-imH)<inf loc="post">2</inf>(9-aca)] (<bold>2</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">22.87</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">34.54</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">1.58</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(4-Ph-imH)<inf loc="post">2</inf>(9-aca)] (<bold>3</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">50.21</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">76.08</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">2.53</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(2-Mebenz-imH)<inf loc="post">2</inf>(9-aca)] (<bold>4</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">25.96</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">29.82</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">2.62</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(2-Mebenz-im)] (<bold>6</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">36.14</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">52.21</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">13.07</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(Benz-im)] (<bold>7</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">138.93</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">171.73</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">6.93</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(2-Ph-im)] (<bold>8</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">149.77</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">76.08</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">6.21</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">[Ag(4,5-CN-im)] (<bold>9</bold>)</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">127.22</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">244.49</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">1.73</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">AgNO<inf loc="post">3</inf>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">65.19</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">34.32</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">1.83</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">Silver sulfadiazine</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">73.05</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">50.20</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd"></entry>
</row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
<ce:legend>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0080" view="all">MIC<ce:inf loc="post">100</ce:inf> for Ketoconazole against <ce:italic>C. albicans</ce:italic> is 4.70<ce:hsp sp="0.25"></ce:hsp>μM <ce:cross-ref id="c0290" refid="b0030">[6]</ce:cross-ref>.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:legend>
<ce:table-footnote id="tblfn4">
<ce:label>a</ce:label>
<ce:note-para id="np020" view="all">Previously published <ce:cross-ref id="c0295" refid="b0030">[6]</ce:cross-ref>.</ce:note-para>
</ce:table-footnote>
</ce:table>
clean_text:
Table 3. Antimicrobial activities of the new Ag(I) complexes and the positive controls[^a], AgNO3 and silver sulfadiazine. MIC values are given in μM concentrations of Ag(I) ions.

| Complex | E. coli MIC50 (μM Ag+) | MRSA MIC50 (μM Ag+) | C. albicans MIC100 (μM Ag+) |
|---------|-----------------------|---------------------|----------------------------|
| [Ag4(DMSO)4(9-aca)4]n (1) | 22.12 | 22.38 | 1.92 |
| [Ag(2-Me-imH)2(9-aca)] (2) | 22.87 | 34.54 | 1.58 |
| [Ag(4-Ph-imH)2(9-aca)] (3) | 50.21 | 76.08 | 2.53 |
| [Ag(2-Mebenz-imH)2(9-aca)] (4) | 25.96 | 29.82 | 2.62 |
| [Ag(2-Mebenz-im)] (6) | 36.14 | 52.21 | 13.07 |
| [Ag(Benz-im)] (7) | 138.93 | 171.73 | 6.93 |
| [Ag(2-Ph-im)] (8) | 149.77 | 76.08 | 6.21 |
| [Ag(4,5-CN-im)] (9) | 127.22 | 244.49 | 1.73 |
| AgNO3 | 65.19 | 34.32 | 1.83 |
| Silver sulfadiazine | 73.05 | 50.20 | |

[^a]: Previously published [6].

Table 3. MIC100 for Ketoconazole against C. albicans is 4.70μM [6].

etc.value: E. coli MIC50: 22.12 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 22.38 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 1.92 μM Ag+

E. coli MIC50: 25.96 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 29.82 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 2.62 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 36.14 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 52.21 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 13.07 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 138.93 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 171.73 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 6.93 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 149.77 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 76.08 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 6.21 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 127.22 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 244.49 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 1.73 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 65.19 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 34.32 μM Ag+, C. albicans MIC100: 1.83 μM Ag+
E. coli MIC50: 73.05 μM Ag+, MRSA MIC50: 50.20 μM Ag+
